brand_identity.name: SplitSync
brand_identity.description: A minimalist, friction-free bill splitting tool for modern friendships.
brand_identity.voice: Direct, precise, slightly playful (receipt printer humor)

heading.usage: Use tight tracking for all headings. Bold for emphasis.

mono.usage: ALL currency values, dates, and transaction IDs must use this font to evoke a receipt aesthetic.

usage_rules: Use monochrome (Black/White/Greys) for 90% of the UI.
Use accents ONLY for status (Owed/Owes) or User Avatars.
Never use gradients for backgrounds. Keep it flat and paper-like.

strategies: Desktop: Bento Grid. Sidebar (Nav) + Main Content (Feed) + Right Panel (Summary).
Whitespace: Use relaxed spacing. Don't crowd the data.

visual_enhancers.textures: Add a subtle noise texture to the background if possible (opacity 0.02).
visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: Use backdrop-blur-md for sticky headers and modals, but keep opacity high (bg-white/90).

custom_components: ReceiptCard: A card with a jagged bottom edge (CSS mask) to look like a torn receipt.
MoneyInput: Massive font size input for entering amounts.

patterns: Page Transition: Opacity fade + slight Y-axis slide.
Interactive: Buttons scale down (0.98) on click.

universal_guidelines: Do NOT use 'Inter' for Headings if 'Space Grotesk' or similar is available. If not, use 'Inter' with tight tracking.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
All interactive elements MUST have data-testid attributes.
Date pickers must use Shadcn Calendar.
Dropdowns must use Shadcn DropdownMenu or Select.
implementation_steps: Step 1: Configure Tailwind with custom colors and fonts.
Step 2: Install Shadcn components (button, input, card, etc).
Step 3: Build the 'MoneyInput' and 'ReceiptCard' custom components.
Step 4: Implement the Auth pages (Login/Register) with a clean split layout.
Step 5: Build the Dashboard with Bento grid layout.
Step 6: Implement Group and Expense logic with responsive tables.
